Package com.intellij.application.options.codeStyle.arrangement.component

Class ArrangementAndMatchConditionComponent

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • com.intellij.application.options.codeStyle.arrangement.component.ArrangementAndMatchConditionComponent
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ArrangementUiComponent, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class ArrangementAndMatchConditionComponent
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements ArrangementUiComponent
    Component for showing composite nodes.

    Not thread-safe.

    See Also:

      • onMouseMove

        public java.awt.Rectangle onMouseMove(java.awt.event.MouseEvent event)
        Description copied from interface: ArrangementUiComponent
        Notifies current component about mose move event.

        Primary intention is to allow to react on event like 'on mouse hover' etc. We can't do that by subscribing to the mouse events at the corresponding UI control because it's used only as a renderer and is not put to the containers hierarchy, hence, doesn't receive mouse events.

        Specified by:
        onMouseMove in interface ArrangementUiComponent
        Parameters:
        event - target mouse move event
        Returns:
        bounds to be repainted (in screen coordinates) if any; null otherwise
